node.description: Implements various control and monitoring functions of the Optohybrid
Loopback data register for testing read/write communication with the Optohybrid FPGA
Optohybrid Firmware Release Date and Version

Optohybrid Release Version (XX.YY.ZZ.AA) \\ XX indicates the firmware major version \\ YY indicates the firmware minor version \\ ZZ indicates the firmware patch \\ AA indicates the hardware generation (0C = GE1/1 v3C short, 1C = GE1/1 v3C long, 2A = GE2/1 v1)
Connects to Outputs of the FPGA's built-in single event upset monitoring system
Counts of critical single event upsets
Counts of corrected single event upsets
Controls the 12 VFAT reset outputs from the FPGA
OH won't wait for bc0 to start sending trigger
OH trigger is stopped waiting for bc0
BXN Synchronization Error; Local BXN and received BXN do not match
Local BXN counter offset (starting value at resync)
Trigger cluster rate measured in Hz

HDMI Connector Control: \\ Mode=0: Each signal is a single VFAT. The VFAT of interest is chosen by SBIT_SEL \\ Mode=1: Each signal is the OR of three VFATs in an ieta row. The row of interest is configured by SBIT_SEL \\ Mode=2: Each signal is the OR of four VFATs in an iphi half column (e.g. 0-3, 4-7, 8-11, 12-15, 16-19, 20-23)
Pulse to take a counter snapshot
0=enable snapshots (counters freeze synchronously and need a snapshot to update)
Write to set the soft logic reset of the Optohybrid FPGA
Connects to the Virtex-6 XADC and allows for reading of temperature, VCCINT, and VCCAUX voltages
Connects to the trigger control module
Controls and monitors various parameters of the S-bit deserialization and cluster building.
Set programmable oneshot deadtime which applies to retriggers on individual VFAT channels
&NUM_VFATS_PER_OH; bit list of VFATs with hits in this BX
Overflow Counter (more than 8 clusters in a bx)
Number of link consecutive good frames required before the transmission unit is marked as good and S-bits can be produced
&NUM_VFATS_PER_OH; bit list of VFATs with stable Start-of-frame pulses (in sync for a number of clock cycles)
&NUM_VFATS_PER_OH; bit list of VFATs with unstable Start-of-frame pulses (became misaligned after already achieving lock)
&NUM_VFATS_PER_OH; bit list of VFATs with a invalid bitskip counter for Start-of-frame pulses
Controls the polarity of S-bit signals to account for polarity swaps on the GEB or OH
Multiplexed copy of Sbits from a selected VFAT
Select a VFAT which will connect to the S-bit multiplexer
VFAT Trigger Unit Mask \\ Set a pair to 1 to invert it

S-BIT Counters \\ Set CNT_PERSIST to 1 to accumulate. Otherwise the counters will automatically reset after a programmable time (default is 1 second). By default this time is 1 second, making these counters a rate counter in Hertz
1=counters will persist until manually reset; \n 0=counters will automatically reset at CNT_TIME
Number of BX that the VFAT S-bit counters will count to before automatically resetting to zero
More than 64 * ${OVERFLOW_IDX} Sbits in a bx Counter

Controls the tap delay settings of the S-bit trigger unit inputs. Phase shifts the inputs in 78 ps increments \\ The delay of each S-bit in a VFAT should be increased to match the longest delay incurred by the GEB + Optohybrid routing on that VFAT
Controls and monitors the multi-gigabit links that drive the trigger fiber tranceivers

This port resets the TX PLL of the GTX transceiver when driven High. It affects the clock generated from the TX PMA. When this reset is asserted or deasserted, TXRESET must also be asserted or deasserted.
Asserts the MGT reset (GTXTXRESET). This sequence takes about 120 us to complete and systematically resets all subcomponents of the GTX transceiver TX.
Initiates a double reset of the TX output clock dividers
PCS TX system reset. Resets the TX FIFO, 8B/10B encoder and other transmitter registers. This reset is a subset of GTXTXRESET.
Resets the TX_SYNC module to realign the buf_bypass alignment FSM
Set the MGT tx into powerdown. The type of powerdown is controlled by TXPOWERDOWN_MODE

00: P0 (normal operation) 
 01: P0s (low recovery time power down) 
 10: P1 (longer recovery time 
 Receiver Detection still on) 
 11: P2 (lowest power state)
Input to power down the TX PLL.
Set high to force MGTs not ready and gate the clocks for and reset the rest of the FPGA logic
sbit monitor module which shows the first valid sbit clusters after a reset on the selected link
Reset the sbit monitor module and re-arm for triggering
Number of BX between this sbit and the subsequent L1A
The Sbit hitmap module accumulates all incoming Sbits during a period of time
Sbits are accumulated as long as this flag is set
Accumulator for Sbit 63 to 32 of VFAT${VFAT_HITMAP_IDX}
Accumulator for Sbit 31 to 0 of VFAT${VFAT_HITMAP_IDX}
Controls and monitors the status of the Optohybrid clocks
Contains functionality for controlling and monitoring the bidirectional GBTx to FPGA link
Controls and monitors the transmit link from the FPGA to the GBTx
Number of wishbone responses sent back
GBT TX READY from GBTx Chip
Controls and monitors the transmit link from the GBTx to the FPGA
GBT RX READY from GBTx Chip
GBT RX VALID from GBTx Chip
Number of GBT link errrors detected
Emulates the TTC commands from GBTx through Wishbone
